082/**
083 *  Library of utility methods that are useful when dealing with Strings. <br>
084 *  <br>Parts of the code were adopted from the class
085 *  <code>org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils</code> and modified to match the
086 *  requirements of this project. In particular, these are the methods
087 *  <ul>
088 *  <li>{@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int) abbreviate()}</li>
089 *  <li>{@link #capitalize(CharSequence) capitalize()}</li>
090 *  <li>{@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence) escapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
091 *  <li>{@link #isEmpty(CharSequence) isEmpty()}</li>
092 *  <li>{@link #isNotEmpty(CharSequence) isNotEmpty()}</li>
093 *  <li>{@link #repeat(CharSequence, int) repeat()}</li>
094 *  <li>{@link #uncapitalize(CharSequence) uncapitalize()}</li>
095 *  <li>{@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence) unescapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
096 *  </ul>
097 *
098 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
099 *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $
100 *  @since 0.0.3
101 *
102 *  @UMLGraph.link
103 */
104@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
105@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $" )
106@UtilityClass
107public final class StringUtils
108{
109        /*---------------*\
110    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
111        \*---------------*/
112    /**
113     *  The clipping mode that is used for the method
114     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
115     *
116     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
117     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $
118     *  @since 0.0.3
119     *
120     *  @UMLGraph.link
121     */
122    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
123    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $" )
124    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
125    public static enum Clipping
126    {
127            /*------------------*\
128        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
129            \*------------------*/
130        /**
131         *  If an input String is already longer than the target length, it
132         *  will be returned unchanged.
133         */
134        CLIPPING_NONE
135        {
136            /**
137             *  {@inheritDoc}
138             */
139            @Override
140            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return s.toString(); }
141        },
142
143        /**
144         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
145         *  just shortened to that length.
146         */
147        CLIPPING_CUT
148        {
149            /**
150             *  {@inheritDoc}
151             */
152            @Override
153            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length )
154            {
155                final var retValue = (s.length() > length ? s.subSequence( 0, length ) : s).toString();
156
157                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
158                return retValue;
159            }   //  clip()
160        },
161
162        /**
163         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
164         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
165         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}
166         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 4.
167         */
168        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE
169        {
170            /**
171             *  {@inheritDoc}
172             */
173            @Override
174            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviate( s, length ); }
175        },
176
177        /**
178         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
179         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
180         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviateMiddle(CharSequence, int)}
181         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 5.
182         */
183        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
184        {
185            /**
186             *  {@inheritDoc}
187             */
188            @Override
189            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviateMiddle( s, length ); }
190        };
191
192            /*---------*\
193        ====** Methods **======================================================
194            \*---------*/
195        /**
196         *  Clips the given input String.
197         *
198         *  @param  s   The input String.
199         *  @param  length  The target length.
200         *  @return The result String.
201         */
202        protected abstract String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length );
203    }
204    //  enum Clipping
205
206    /**
207     *  The padding mode that is used for the methods
208     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,boolean)}
209     *  and
210     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
211     *
212     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
213     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $
214     *  @since 0.0.5
215     *
216     *  @UMLGraph.link
217     */
218    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
219    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $" )
220    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
221    public static enum Padding
222    {
223            /*------------------*\
224        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
225            \*------------------*/
226        /**
227         *  The pad characters are distributed evenly at begin and end of the
228         *  string.
229         */
230        PADDING_CENTER
231        {
232            /**
233             *  {@inheritDoc}
234             */
235            @Override
236            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
237            {
238                final var rightSize = padSize / 2;
239                final var leftSize = padSize - rightSize;
240                final var retValue = padding( leftSize, c ) + s.toString() + padding( rightSize, c );
241
242                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
243                return retValue;
244            }   //  pad()
245        },
246
247        /**
248         *  The pad characters are added at the beginning of the string
249         *  (prefixing it).
250         */
251        PADDING_LEFT
252        {
253            /**
254             *  {@inheritDoc}
255             */
256            @Override
257            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
258            {
259                return padding( padSize, c ) + s.toString();
260            }   //  pad()
261        },
262
263        /**
264         *  The pad characters are added the end of the string (as a suffix).
265         */
266        PADDING_RIGHT
267        {
268            /**
269             *  {@inheritDoc}
270             */
271            @Override
272            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
273            {
274                return s.toString() + padding( padSize, c );
275            }   //  pad()
276        };
277
278            /*---------*\
279        ====** Methods **======================================================
280            \*---------*/
281        /**
282         *  Pads the given input String.
283         *
284         *  @param  s   The input String.
285         *  @param  padSize The pad size.
286         *  @param  c   The pad character.
287         *  @return The result String.
288         */
289        protected abstract String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c );
290
291        /**
292         *  Returns padding using the specified pad character repeated to the
293         *  given length.<br>
294         *  <br><code>
295         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;0,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
296         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;3,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"eee"<br>
297         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;-2,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;IndexOutOfBoundsException<br>
298         *  </code>
299         *
300         *  @param  repeat  Number of times to repeat {@code padChar}; must be
301         *      0 or greater.
302         *  @param  padChar Character to repeat.
303         *  @return String with repeated {@code padChar} character, or the
304         *      empty String if {@code repeat} is 0.
305         *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {@code repeat} is less than 0.
306         *
307         *  @see StringUtils#repeat(int,int)
308         */
309        private static String padding( final int repeat, final char padChar ) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
310        {
311            if( repeat < 0 ) throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException( format( MSG_PadNegative, repeat ) );
312
313            final var retValue = Character.toString( padChar ).repeat( repeat ).intern();
314
315            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
316            return retValue;
317        }   //  padding()
318    }
319    //  enum Padding
320
321        /*-----------*\
322    ====** Constants **========================================================
323        \*-----------*/
324    /**
325     *  <p>{@summary The regular expression for an HTML or XML comment:
326     *  {@value}.}</p>
327     *  <p>This pattern is used by the
328     *  {@link #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)}
329     *  method.</p>
330     *
331     *  @since 0.0.5
332     */
333    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
334    public static final String COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN = "<!--.+?-->";
335
336    /**
337     *  The initial buffer size that is used by
338     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)}
339     *  and
340     *  {@link #format(Locale, String, Object...)}
341     *  (per thread): {@value}.
342     *
343     *  @since 0.0.5
344     */
345    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
346    public static final int FORMAT_INITIAL_BUFFERSIZE = 2048;
347
348    /**
349     *  The message text indicating that the given value for the abbreviation
350     *  target length is too short.
351     */
352    private static final String MSG_AbbrTooShort = "The minimum abbreviation width is %d";
353
354    /**
355     *  The message indicating that the give size for padding is negative.
356     */
357    private static final String MSG_PadNegative = "Cannot pad a negative amount: %d";
358
359    /**
360     *  The maximum size to which the padding constant(s) can expand: {@value}.
361     *
362     *  @see #repeat(CharSequence,int) repeat() for String
363     *  @see #repeat(char,int) repeat() for char
364     */
365    @SuppressWarnings( "unused" )
366    private static final int PAD_LIMIT = 8192;
367
368    /**
369     *  The regular expression for an HTML or XML tag: {@value}.<br>
370     *  <br>This pattern is used by the
371     *  {@link #stripTags(CharSequence)}
372     *  method.<br>
373     *  <br>As HTML/XML comments may contain a &quot;greater than&quot; sign
374     *  ('&gt;' or '&amp;gt;'), it is necessary to treat comments
375     *  separately.<br>
376     *  <br>Just as a reminder: several sources recommend using the following
377     *  idiom for embedded JavaScript:<pre><code>  &lt;script&gt;
378     *  &lt;!--
379     *  <i>JavaScript code </i>
380     *  --&gt;
381     *  &lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>
382     *
383     *  @since 0.0.5
384     */
385    @SuppressWarnings( "RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup" )
386    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
387    public static final String TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN = "(?:<!--.+?-->)|(?:<[^>]+?>)";
388
389    /**
390     *  The regular expression to identify a variable in a char sequence:
391     *  {@value}.
392     *
393     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
394     *  @see #isValidVariableName(CharSequence)
395     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence,Map...)
396     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Function)
397     *
398     *  @since 0.0.5
399     *  @deprecated Use
400     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_PATTERN}
401     *      instead.
402     */
403    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
404    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
405    public static final String VARIABLE_PATTERN = Template.VARIABLE_PATTERN;
406
407    /**
408     *  The template for variables: {@value}. The argument is the name of the
409     *  variable itself; after an optional prefix character, it may not contain
410     *  other characters than the letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower
411     *  case), the digits from '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore
412     *  ('_') and dot ('.').<br>
413     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
414     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
415     *  ('&amp;').<br>
416     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
417     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
418     *  special variable.
419     *
420     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
421     *
422     *  @since 0.0.5
423     *  @deprecated Use
424     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_TEMPLATE}
425     *      instead.
426     */
427    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
428    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
429    public static final String VARIABLE_TEMPLATE = Template.VARIABLE_TEMPLATE;
430

432    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
433        \*------------------------*/
434    /**
435     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML comment.
436     *
437     *  @see #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)
438     *  @see #COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN
439     */
440    private static final Pattern m_CommentRemovalPattern;
441
442    /**
443     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML tag.
444     *
445     *  @see #stripTags(CharSequence)
446     *  @see #TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN
447     */
448    private static final Pattern m_TagRemovalPattern;
449
450    static
451    {
452        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
453        try
454        {
455            m_CommentRemovalPattern = compile( COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
456            m_TagRemovalPattern = compile( TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
457        }
458        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
459        {
460            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
461        }
462    }

468     *  No instance of this class is allowed.
469     */
470    private StringUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( StringUtils.class ); }

472        /*---------*\
473    ====** Methods **==========================================================
474        \*---------*/
475    /**
476     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
477     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
478     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is the time for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
479     *  <br>Specifically:
480     *  <ul>
481     *  <li>If {@code text} is less than {@code maxWidth} characters long,
482     *  return it unchanged.</li>
483     *  <li>Else abbreviate it to <code>(substring( text, 0, max - 1 ) +
484     *  &quot;\u2026&quot; )</code>.</li>
485     *  <li>If {@code maxWidth} is less than 4, throw an
486     *  {@link ValidationException}.</li>
487     *  <li>In no case it will return a String of length greater than
488     *  {@code maxWidth}.</li>
489     *  </ul>
490     *  Some samples:<br>
491     *  <pre><code>
492     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, * )      = null
493     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 4 )        = ""
494     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abc", 4 ) = "abc"
495     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcd", 4 ) = "abcd;"
496     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 4 ) = "abc&hellip;"
497     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 7 ) = "abcdefg"
498     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 8 ) = "abcdefg"
499     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 3 ) = IllegalArgumentException
500     *  </code></pre>
501     *
502     *  @param  text    The String to abbreviate, can be {@code null}.
503     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
504     *      least 4.
505     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
506     *      already {@code null}.
507     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
508     *      than 4.
509     *
510     *  @since 0.0.5
511     */
512    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
513    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
514    {
515        return abbreviate( text, 0, maxWidth );
516    }   //  abbreviate()
517
518    /**
519     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
520     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
521     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>&hellip;is the time
522     *  for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
523     *  <br>Works like
524     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)},
525     *  but allows to specify a &quot;left edge&quot; offset. Note that this
526     *  left edge is not necessarily going to be the leftmost character in the
527     *  result, or the first character following the ellipses, but it will
528     *  appear somewhere in the result. An offset less than 0 will be treated
529     *  as 0, a value greater than {@code maxWidth} will be ignored.<br>
530     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
531     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
532     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
533     *  <pre>
534     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, *, * )                = null
535     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 0, 4 )                  = ""
536     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", -1, 10 ) = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
537     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 0, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
538     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 1, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
539     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 4, 10 )  = "&hellip;efghijkl&hellip;"
540     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 5, 10 )  = "&hellip;fghijklm&hellip;"
541     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 6, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
542     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 8, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
543     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 10, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
544     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 12, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
545     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 0, 3 )        = IllegalArgumentException
546     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 5, 6 )        = IllegalArgumentException
547     *  </pre>
548     *
549     *  @param  text    The String to process, can be {@code null}.
550     *  @param  offset  The left edge of the source String; this value will not
551     *      be checked.
552     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
553     *      least 4.
554     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
555     *      already {@code null}.
556     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
557     *      than 4.
558     *
559     *  @since 0.0.5
560     */
561    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
562    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int offset, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
563    {
564        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
565
566        String retValue = null;
567        if( nonNull( text ) )
568        {
569            if( maxWidth < 4 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 4 ) );
570
571            final var len = text.length();
572            if( len > maxWidth )
573            {
574                var effectiveOffset = min( offset, len);
575                if( (len - effectiveOffset) < (maxWidth - 1))
576                {
577                    effectiveOffset = len - (maxWidth - 1);
578                }
579                if( effectiveOffset <= 1 )
580                {
581                    retValue = text.subSequence( 0, maxWidth - 1 ) + ellipsis;
582                }
583                else
584                {
585                    if( ((effectiveOffset + maxWidth) - 1) < len )
586                    {
587                        retValue = ellipsis + abbreviate( text.subSequence( effectiveOffset, len ), maxWidth - 1 );
588                    }
589                    else
590                    {
591                        retValue = ellipsis + text.subSequence( len - (maxWidth - 1), len );
592                    }
593                }
594            }
595            else
596            {
597                retValue = text.toString();
598            }
599        }
600
601        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
602        return retValue;
603    }   //  abbreviate()
604
605    /**
606     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
607     *  0x2026) in the middle of the returned text. This will turn &quot;<i>Now
608     *  is the time for all good men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is &hellip;
609     *  good men</i>&quot;<br>
610     *  <br>Works like
611     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}.<br>
612     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
613     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
614     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
615     *  <pre>
616     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle(null, *)      = null
617     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("", 5)        = ""
618     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 5) = "ab&hellip;gh"
619     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 7) = "ab&hellip;gh"
620     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 8) = "abcdefgh"
621     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 4) = IllegalArgumentException
622     *  </pre>
623     *
624     *  @param  str The String to check, may be {@code null}.
625     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
626     *      least 5.
627     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
628     *      already {@code null}.
629     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
630     *      than 5.
631     *
632     *  @since 0.0.5
633     */
634    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
635    public static final String abbreviateMiddle( final CharSequence str, final int maxWidth )
636    {
637        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
638
639        String retValue = null;
640        if( nonNull( str ) )
641        {
642            if( maxWidth < 5 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 5 ) );
643
644            final var len = str.length();
645            if( len > maxWidth )
646            {
647                final var suffixLength = (maxWidth - 1) / 2;
648                final var prefixLength = maxWidth - 1 - suffixLength;
649                final var suffixStart = len - suffixLength;
650                retValue = str.subSequence( 0, prefixLength ) + ellipsis + str.subSequence( suffixStart, suffixStart + suffixLength );
651            }
652            else
653            {
654                retValue = str.toString();
655            }
656        }
657
658        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
659        return retValue;
660    }   //  abbreviateMiddle()
661
662    /**
663     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a long string into chunks of the given length.}</p>
664     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
665     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array or a
666     *  collection.</p>
667     *  <p>To array:</p>
668     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
669     *  <p>To collection (here: a
670     *  {@link List}):</p>
671     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
672     *
673     *  @param  s   The string.
674     *  @param  chunk   The chunk size.
675     *  @return The chunks from the string; the last chunk could be shorter
676     *      than the others.
677     *
678     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
679     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
680     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
681     *
682     *  @since 0.0.5
683     */
684    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
685    public static final Stream<String> breakString( final CharSequence s, final int chunk )
686    {
687        if( chunk < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Chunk size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", chunk ) );
688
689        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
690        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
691        var pos = 0;
692        while( (pos + chunk) < len )
693        {
694            builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, pos + chunk ).toString() );
695            pos += chunk;
696        }
697        if( pos < len ) builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, len ).toString() );
698
699        final var retValue = builder.build();
700
701        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
702        return retValue;
703    }   //  breakString()
704
705    /**
706     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a text into lines of the given length, but
707     *  different from
708     *  {@link #breakString(CharSequence, int)},
709     *  it will honour whitespace.}</p>
710     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
711     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array, a String, or
712     *  a collection.</p>
713     *  <p>To array:</p>
714     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
715     *  <p>To String:</p>
716     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.joining() )</code></pre>
717     *  <p>To collection (here: a
718     *  {@link List}):</p>
719     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
720     *
721     *  @param  text    The text.
722     *  @param  lineLength  The length of a line.
723     *  @return The lines; if a word is longer than the given line length, a
724     *      line containing only that word can be longer that the given line
725     *      length.
726     *
727     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
728     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
729     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
730     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence)
731     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence)
732     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
733     *
734     *  @since 0.0.5
735     */
736    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
737    public static final Stream<String> breakText( final CharSequence text, final int lineLength )
738    {
739        if( lineLength < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Line length size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", lineLength ) );
740
741        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
742
743        for( final var line : splitString( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ), '\n' ) )
744        {
745            if( isEmptyOrBlank( line ) )
746            {
747                builder.add( EMPTY_STRING );
748            }
749            else
750            {
751                final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
752                final var chunks = line.split( "\\s" );
753                SplitLoop: for( final var c : chunks )
754                {
755                    if( c.isEmpty() ) continue SplitLoop;
756                    if( (buffer.length() + 1 + c.length()) < lineLength )
757                    {
758                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer) ) buffer.append( ' ' );
759                    }
760                    else
761                    {
762                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) )
763                        {
764                            builder.add( buffer.toString() );
765                            buffer.setLength( 0 );
766                        }
767                    }
768                    buffer.append( c );
769                }   //  SplitLoop:
770                if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) ) builder.add( buffer.toString() );
771            }
772        }
773
774        final var retValue = builder.build();
775
776        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
777        return retValue;
778    }   //  breakText()
779
780    /**
781     *  <p>{@summary <i>Capitalises</i> a String, meaning changing the first
782     *  letter to upper case as per
783     *  {@link Character#toUpperCase(char)}.} No other letters are changed.</p>
784     *  <p>A {@code null} input String returns {@code null}.</p>
785     *  <p>Samples:</p>
786     *  <pre><code>  StringUtils.capitalize( null )  == null;
787     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;&quot; )    == &quot;&quot;;
788     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cat&quot; ) == &quot;Cat&quot;;
789     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cAt&quot; ) == &quot;CAt&quot;;</code></pre>
790     *  <p>Use this function to create a getter or setter name from the name of
791     *  the attribute.</p>
792     *  <p>This method does not recognise the
793     *  {@linkplain java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}.
794     *  This means that &quot;istanbul&quot; will become &quot;Istanbul&quot;
795     *  even for the locale {@code tr_TR} (although &quot;&#x130;stanbul&quot;
796     *  would be correct).</p>
797     *
798     *  @param c    The String to capitalise, can be {@code null}.
799     *  @return The capitalised String, or {@code null} if the argument
800     *      was already {@code null}.
801     *
802     *  @see #decapitalize(CharSequence)
803     *
804     *  @since 0.0.5
805     */
806    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
807    public static final String capitalize( final CharSequence c )
808    {
809        String retValue = null;
810        if( nonNull( c ) )
811        {
812            final var s = c.toString();
813            if( s.isEmpty() )
814            {
815                retValue = s;
816            }
817            else
818            {
819                retValue = (toUpperCase( s.charAt( 0 ) ) + s.substring( 1 )).intern();
820            }
821        }
822
823        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
824        return retValue;
825    }   //  capitalize()
826
827    /**
828     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
829     *  longer than the given maximum length.
830     *
831     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
832     *      will be thrown.
833     *  @param  text    The text to check.
834     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
835     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
836     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
837     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
838     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
839     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
840     *      {@code maxLength}.
841     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException {@code text} is the empty String.
842     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
843     *      {@code null}.
844     *
845     *  @deprecated Replaced by
846     *      {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)}
847     */
848    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
849    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
850    public static final String checkText( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
851    {
852        return checkTextLen( name, text, maxLength );
853    }   //  checkText()

855    /**
856     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
857     *  longer than the given maximum length. Use this to check whether a
858     *  String that is provided as an argument to a method is longer than
859     *  expected.
860     *
861     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
862     *      will be thrown. Usually this is the name of the argument to
863     *      validate.
864     *  @param  text    The text to check.
865     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
866     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
867     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
868     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
869     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
870     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
871     *      {@code maxLength}.
872     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
873     *      the empty String.
874     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
875     *      {@code null}.
876     *
877     *  @since 0.0.5
878     */
879    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
880    public static final String checkTextLen( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
881    {
882        if( requireNotEmptyArgument( text, requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ) ).length() > maxLength )
883        {
884            throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
885        }
886
887        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
888        return text.toString();
889    }   //  checkTextLen()
890
891    /**
892     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
893     *  different from
894     *  {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)},
895     *  it may be {@code null} or empty.
896     *
897     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
898     *      will be thrown.
899     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
900     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
901     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String, {@code null}
902     *      if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the argument fails any of the
903     *      tests, an
904     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
905     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
906     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
907     *      {@code maxLength}.
908     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is empty.
909     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
910     *
911     *  @since 0.0.5
912     */
913    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
914    public static final String checkTextLenNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException
915    {
916        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
917
918        String retValue = null;
919        if( nonNull( text ) )
920        {
921            if( text.length() > maxLength )
922            {
923                throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
924            }
925            retValue = text.toString();
926        }
927
928        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
929        return retValue;
930    }   //  checkTextLenNull()
931
932    /**
933     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
934     *  it may be {@code null}.
935     *
936     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
937     *      will be thrown.
938     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
939     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
940     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String,
941     *      {@code null} if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the
942     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
943     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
944     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
945     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
946     *      {@code maxLength}.
947     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
948     *
949     *  @deprecated Replaced by
950     *      {@link #checkTextLenNull(String, CharSequence, int)}.
951     */
952    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
953    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
954    public static final String checkTextNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength )
955    {
956        return checkTextLenNull( name, text, maxLength );
957    }   //  checkTextNull()
958
959    /**
960     *  Changes the first letter of the given String tolower case as per
961     *  {@link Character#toLowerCase(char)}.
962     *  No other letters are changed. A {@code null} input String returns
963     *  {@code null}.<br>
964     *  <br>Samples:<pre><code>  StringUtils.decapitalize( null ) = null;
965     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;&quot;)     = &quot;&quot;;
966     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;Cat&quot;)  = &quot;cat&quot;;
967     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;CAT&quot;)  = &quot;cAT&quot;;</code></pre>
968     *  <br>Basically, this is the complementary method to
969     *  {@link #capitalize(CharSequence)}.
970     *  Use this method to normalise the name of bean attributes.
971     *
972     *  @param  s   The String to <i>decapitalise</i>, may be {@code null}.
973     *  @return The <i>decapitalised</i> String, {@code null} if the argument
974     *      was {@code null}.
975     *  @see #capitalize(CharSequence)
976     *
977     *  @since 0.0.5
978     */
979    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
980    public static final String decapitalize( final CharSequence s )
981    {
982        String retValue = null;
983
984        if( nonNull( s ) )
985        {
986            retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
987            if( isNotEmpty( s ) )
988            {
989                final var str = s.toString();
990                retValue = (toLowerCase( str.charAt( 0 ) ) + str.substring( 1 )).intern();
991            }
992        }
993
994        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
995        return retValue;
996    }   //  decapitalize()
997
998    /**
999     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the non-ASCII and special characters in a
1000     *  {@code String} so that the result can be used in the context of HTML.}
1001     *  Wherever possible, the method will return the respective HTML&nbsp;5
1002     *  entity; only when there is no matching entity, it will use the Unicode
1003     *  escape.</p>
1004     *  <p>So if you call the method with the argument
1005     *  &quot;<i>S&uuml;&szlig;e</i>&quot;, it will return
1006     *  &quot;<code>S&amp;uuml;&amp;szlig;e</code>&quot;.</p>
1007     *  <p>If the input will be, for example, a Chinese text like this:
1008     *  &quot;<i>çä½</i>&quot; (means "Ball"), you may get back something like
1009     *  this: &quot;<code>&amp;#x7403;&amp;#x4F53;</code>&quot;, as there are
1010     *  no entities defined for (any) Chinese letters.</p>
1011     *  <p>The method supports all known HTML&nbsp;5.0 entities, including
1012     *  funky accents. But it will not escape several commonly used characters
1013     *  like the full stop ('.'), the comma (','), the colon (':'), or the
1014     *  semicolon (';'), although they will be handled properly by
1015     *  {@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)}.</p>
1016     *  <p>Note that the commonly used apostrophe escape character
1017     *  (&amp;apos;) that was not a legal entity for HTML before HTML&nbsp;5 is
1018     *  now supported.</p>
1019     *
1020     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1021     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1022     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1023     *
1024     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1025     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1026     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1027     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1028     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1029     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1030     *
1031     *  @since 0.0.5
1032     */
1033    /*
1034     *  For some unknown reasons, JavaDoc will not accept the entities &#x7403;
1035     *  and &#x4F53; (for 'ç' and 'ä½'), therefore it was required to add the
1036     *  Chinese character directly into the comment above.
1037     */
1038    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1039    public static final String escapeHTML( final CharSequence str )
1040    {
1041        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? HTML50.escape( str ) : null;
1042
1043        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1044        return retValue;
1045    }   //  escapeHTML()
1046
1047    /**
1048     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using HTML entities and
1049     *  writes them to an
1050     *  {@link Appendable}.
1051     *  For details, refer to
1052     *  {@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence)}.
1053     *
1054     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1055     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1056     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1057     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1058     *      from calls to the
1059     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1060     *      method.
1061     *
1062     *  @see #escapeHTML(CharSequence)
1063     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1064     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1065     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1066     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1067     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1068     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1069     *
1070     *  @since 0.0.5
1071     */
1072    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1073    public static final void escapeHTML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1074    {
1075        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1076
1077        if( nonNull( str ) ) HTML50.escape( appendable, str );
1078    }   //  escapeHTML()
1079
1080    /**
1081     *  Formats the given {@code String} for the output into JSONText. This
1082     *  means that the input sequence will be surrounded by double quotes, and
1083     *  backslash sequences are put into all the right places.<br>
1084     *  <br>&lt; and &gt; will be inserted as their Unicode values, allowing
1085     *  JSON text to be delivered in HTML.<br>
1086     *  <br>In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an
1087     *  unescaped quote or backslash, so these are translated to Unicode
1088     *  escapes also.
1089     *
1090     *  @param  str The string to escape to the JSON format; it may be empty,
1091     *      but not {@code null}.
1092     *  @return A string correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
1093     *
1094     *  @since 0.0.5
1095     */
1096    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1097    public static final String escapeJSON( final CharSequence str )
1098    {
1099        var retValue = "\"\""; // The JSON empty string.
1100        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ).length();
1101        if( len > 0 )
1102        {
1103            final var buffer = new StringBuilder( len * 2 ).append( '"' );
1104            char c;
1105            for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
1106            {
1107                c = str.charAt( i );
1108                switch( c )
1109                {
1110                    case '\\':
1111                    case '"':
1112                    case '<':
1113                    case '>':
1114                    case '&':
1115                        buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1116                        break;
1117
1118                    case '\b':
1119                        buffer.append( "\\b" );
1120                        break;
1121
1122                    case '\t':
1123                        buffer.append( "\\t" );
1124                        break;
1125
1126                    case '\n':
1127                        buffer.append( "\\n" );
1128                        break;
1129
1130                    case '\f':
1131                        buffer.append( "\\f" );
1132                        break;
1133
1134                    case '\r':
1135                        buffer.append( "\\r" );
1136                        break;
1137
1138                    default:
1139                        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1140                        if( (c < ' ')
1141                            || ((c >= '\u0080') && (c < '\u00a0'))
1142                            || ((c >= '\u2000') && (c < '\u2100')) )
1143                        {
1144                            buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1145                        }
1146                        else
1147                        {
1148                            buffer.append( c );
1149                        }
1150                        break;
1151                }
1152            }
1153            buffer.append( '"' );
1154            retValue = buffer.toString();
1155        }
1156
1157        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1158        return retValue;
1159    }   //  escapeJSON()
1160
1161    /**
1162     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes and writes them to a
1163     *  {@link Appendable}.
1164     *
1165     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1166     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1167     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1168     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1169     *      from calls to the
1170     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1171     *      method.
1172     *
1173     *  @since 0.0.5
1174     */
1175    @SuppressWarnings( "SwitchStatementWithTooManyBranches" )
1176    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1177    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final char c ) throws IOException
1178    {
1179        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1180
1181        TestSwitch: switch( c )
1182        {
1183            case '\\' -> appendable.append( "\\" );
1184            case '[', ']', '{', '}', '(', ')', '^', '$', '&', '*', '.', '+', '|', '?' -> appendable.append( "\\" ).append( c );
1185            case '\t' -> appendable.append( "\\t" );
1186            case '\n' -> appendable.append( "\\n" );
1187            case '\r' -> appendable.append( "\\r" );
1188            case '\f' -> appendable.append( "\\f" );
1189            case '\u0007' -> appendable.append( "\\a" );
1190            case '\u001B' -> appendable.append( "\\e" ); // ESC
1191            default -> appendable.append( c );
1192        }   //  TestSwitch:
1193    }   //  escapeRegex()
1194
1195    /**
1196     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes.
1197     *
1198     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1199     *  @return A {@code String} with the escaped character.
1200     *
1201     *  @since 0.0.5
1202     */
1203    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1204    public static final String escapeRegex( final char c )
1205    {
1206        final var retValue = new StringBuilder();
1207        try
1208        {
1209            escapeRegex( retValue, c );
1210        }
1211        catch( final IOException e )
1212        {
1213            /*
1214             * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1215             * not define an IOException.
1216             */
1217            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1218        }
1219
1220        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1221        return retValue.toString();
1222    }   //  escapeRegex()
1223
1224    /**
1225     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes.
1226     *
1227     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1228     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the argument
1229     *      was already {@code null}.
1230     *
1231     *  @since 0.0.5
1232     */
1233    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1234    public static final String escapeRegex( final CharSequence str )
1235    {
1236        String retValue = null;
1237        if( nonNull( str ) )
1238        {
1239            final var len = str.length();
1240            if( len > 0 )
1241            {
1242                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
1243                try
1244                {
1245                    escapeRegex( buffer, str );
1246                }
1247                catch( final IOException e )
1248                {
1249                    /*
1250                     * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1251                     * not define an IOException.
1252                     */
1253                    throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1254                }
1255                retValue = buffer.toString();
1256            }
1257            else
1258            {
1259                retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
1260            }
1261        }
1262
1263        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1264        return retValue;
1265    }   //  escapeRegex()
1266
1267    /**
1268     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes and
1269     *  writes them to a
1270     *  {@link Appendable}.
1271     *
1272     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1273     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape. If {@code null} or the empty
1274     *      String, nothing will be put to the appendable.
1275     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1276     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1277     *      from calls to the
1278     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1279     *      method.
1280     *
1281     *  @since 0.0.5
1282     */
1283    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1284    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1285    {
1286        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1287
1288        if( isNotEmpty( str ) )
1289        {
1290            ScanLoop: for( var i = 0; i < str.length(); ++i )
1291            {
1292                escapeRegex( appendable, str.charAt( i ) );
1293            }   //  ScanLoop:
1294        }
1295    }   //  escapeRegex()
1296
1297    /**
1298     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given character. This will
1299     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1300     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1301     *  <br>This method should be used only for characters that are not
1302     *  surrogates; for general use, the implementation that takes a code point
1303     *  is preferred.
1304     *
1305     *  @param  c   The character.
1306     *  @return The escape sequence.
1307     *
1308     *  @see #escapeUnicode(int)
1309     *
1310     *  @since 0.0.5
1311     *  @deprecated Use
1312     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(char)}
1313     *      instead.
1314     */
1315    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1316    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1317    public static final String escapeUnicode( final char c ) { return escapeCharacter( c ); }
1318
1319    /**
1320     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given code point. This will
1321     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1322     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1323     *  <br>This method takes only a single code point; to translate a whole
1324     *  String, this code sequence can be used:<pre><code>  &hellip;
1325     *  String result = input.codePoints()
1326     *      .mapToObj( codePoint -&gt; escapeUnicode( codePoint ) )
1327     *      .collect( Collectors.joining() );
1328     *  &hellip;</code></pre>
1329     *  This will escape <i>all</i> characters in the String. If only a subset
1330     *  needs to be escaped, the mapping function in
1331     *  {@link java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction) mapToObj()}
1332     *  can be adjusted accordingly. Something like that is implemented with
1333     *  the method
1334     *  {@link #toUnicode(CharSequence)}.
1335     *
1336     *  @param  codePoint   The character.
1337     *  @return The escape sequence.
1338     *
1339     *  @see String#codePoints()
1340     *  @see java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction)
1341     *  @see java.util.stream.Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
1342     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
1343     *
1344     *  @since 0.0.5
1345     *  @deprecated Use
1346     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(int)}
1347     *      instead.
1348     */
1349    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1350    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1351    public static final String escapeUnicode( final int codePoint ) { return escapeCharacter( codePoint ); }
1352
1353    /**
1354     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1355     *  entities.}</p>
1356     *  <p>For example:</p>
1357     *  <p>{@code "bread" & "butter"}</p>
1358     *  <p>becomes:</p>
1359     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1360     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.</p>
1361     *
1362     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be null.
1363     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1364     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1365     *
1366     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
1367     */
1368    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1369    public static final String escapeXML( final CharSequence str )
1370    {
1371        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? XML.escape( str ) : null;
1372
1373        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1374        return retValue;
1375    }   //  escapeXML()
1376
1377    /**
1378     *  <p>{@summary Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML
1379     *  entities and writes them to an
1380     *  {@link Appendable}.}</p>
1381     *  <p>For example:</p>
1382     *  <p>{@code "bread" & "butter"}</p>
1383     *  <p>becomes:</p>
1384     *  <p><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1385     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.</p>
1386     *
1387     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1388     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.

1390     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1391     *      from calls to the
1392     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1393     *      method.
1394     *
1395     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)

1397     *
1398     *  @since 0.0.5
1399     */
1400    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1401    public static final void escapeXML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1402    {

1408    /**
1409     *  Collects all the variables of the form
1410     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String.<br>
1411     *  <br>If there are not any variables in the given String, an empty
1412     *  {@link Collection}
1413     *  will be returned.<br>
1414     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
1415     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
1416     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
1417     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
1418     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
1419     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
1420     *  ('&amp;').<br>
1421     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
1422     *  special variable.
1423     *
1424     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
1425     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
1426     *
1427     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
1428     *
1429     *  @since 0.0.5
1430     *  @deprecated Use
1431     *      {@link Template#findVariables(CharSequence)}
1432     *      instead.
1433     */
1434    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1435    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1436    public static final Collection<String> findVariables( final CharSequence text )
1437    {
1438        return Template.findVariables( text );
1439    }   //  findVariables()
1440
1441    /**
1442     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified format String and
1443     *  arguments.<br>
1444     *  <br>The implementation uses internally the
1445     *  {@link Locale}
1446     *  that is returned by
1447     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() Locale.getDefault()}.<br>
1448     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1449     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1450     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1451     *  {@link Formatter}
1452     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1453     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1454     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1455     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1456     *  <br>This implementation is about as twice as fast as
1457     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1458     *
1459     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1460     *      {@link Formatter}
1461     *      class.
1462     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1463     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1464     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1465     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1466     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1467     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1468     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1469     *      depends on the conversion.
1470     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1471     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1472     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1473     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1474     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1475     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1476     *  @return A formatted String.
1477     *
1478     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1479     *
1480     *  @since 0.0.5
1481     */
1482    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1483    public static final String format( final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1484    {
1485        return SharedFormatter.format( format, args );
1486    }   //  format()
1487
1488    /**
1489     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified
1490     *  {@link Locale},
1491     *  format String, and arguments.<br>
1492     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1493     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1494     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1495     *  {@link Formatter}
1496     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1497     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1498     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1499     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1500     *  <br>The performance gain for this implementation is not that impressive
1501     *  when compared with that of
1502     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)},
1503     *  but still in the 10% range.
1504     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1505     *
1506     *  @param  locale  The
1507     *      {@link Locale}
1508     *      that will be applied during formatting. If {@code locale} is
1509     *      {@code null} then no localisation is applied.
1510     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1511     *      {@link Formatter}
1512     *      class.
1513     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1514     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1515     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1516     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1517     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1518     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1519     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1520     *      depends on the conversion.
1521     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1522     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1523     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1524     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1525     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1526     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1527     *  @return A formatted String.
1528     *
1529     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1530     *
1531     *  @since 0.0.5
1532     */
1533    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1534    public static final String format( final Locale locale, final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1535    {
1536        return SharedFormatter.format( locale, format, args );
1537    }   //  format()
1538

1724    /**
1725     *  Combines the given
1726     *  {@link Stream}
1727     *  of Strings to a single string, with the given separator.
1728     *
1729     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1730     *  @param  separator   The separator; may be empty, but not {@code null}.
1731     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence stream is empty,
1732     *      the empty String will be returned.
1733     *
1734     *  @deprecated This method is obsolete; the same effect can be achieved
1735     *      easily by calling
1736     *      {@link Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)}
1737     *      on the stream, with the collector
1738     *      {@link java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence) joining()}
1739     *      as its argument.
1740     */
1741    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1742    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )
1743    public static final String joinString( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> s, final CharSequence separator )
1744    {
1745        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).collect( joining( separator ) );
1746
1747        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1748        return retValue;
1749    }   //  joinString()

1751    /**
1752     *  Combines the given String array to a single string, with the given
1753     *  separator.
1754     *
1755     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1756     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1757     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence array is empty, the
1758     *      empty String will be returned.
1759     *
1760     *  @deprecated This method is obsolete; the same effect can be achieved
1761     *      easily by calling
1762     *      {@link String#join(CharSequence, CharSequence...)}.
1763     */
1764    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )
1765    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1766    public static final String joinString( final CharSequence [] s, final char separator )
1767    {
1768        final var retValue = join( Character.toString( separator), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1769
1770        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1771        return retValue;
1772    }   //  joinString()

1776     *  separator.

1780     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence collection is empty, the
1781     *      empty String will be returned.

1787    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )

1789    public static final String joinString( final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> s, final char separator )
1790    {
1791        final var retValue = join( Character.toString( separator), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1792
1793        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1794        return retValue;
1795    }   //  joinString()

1797    /**
1798     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1799     *  collection.<br>
1800     *  <br>For an array, this method can be called like this:<pre><code>  String [] a = {"1", "2", "3"};
1801     *  maxContentLength( Arrays.asList( a ) );</code></pre>
1802     *
1803     *  @param  list    The strings.
1804     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1805     *      in the list are {@code null}.
1806     *
1807     *  @deprecated Use
1808     *      {@link #maxContentLength(CharSequence[])},
1809     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Collection)},
1810     *      or
1811     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Stream)}
1812     *      instead.
1813     */
1814    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
1815    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
1816    public static final int maxContentLength( final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> list )
1817    {
1818        var retValue = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
1819        int len;
1820        for( final var cs : requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ) )
1821        {
1822            len = nonNull( cs ) ? cs.length() : -1;
1823            if( len > retValue )
1824            {
1825                retValue = len;
1826            }
1827        }
1828
1829        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1830        return retValue;
1831    }   //  maxContentLength()
1832
1833    /**
1834     *  Determines the maximum length over all Strings provided in the given
1835     *  {@link Stream}.
1836     *
1837     *  @param  stream  The strings.
1838     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1839     *      in the given {@code stream} are {@code null}, and
1840     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1841     *      if the given {@code stream} is empty.
1842     *
1843     *  @since 0.0.5
1844     */
1845    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1846    public static final int maxContentLength( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> stream )
1847    {
1848        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stream, "stream" )
1849            .mapToInt( s -> nonNull( s ) ? s.length() : -1 )
1850            .max()
1851            .orElse( Integer.MIN_VALUE );
1852
1853        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1854        return retValue;
1855    }   //  maxContentLength()
1856
1857    /**
1858     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1859     *  {@link Collection}.
1860     *
1861     *  @param  list    The strings.
1862     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1863     *      in the given {@code list} are {@code null}, and
1864     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1865     *      if the given {@code list} is empty.
1866     *
1867     *  @since 0.0.5
1868     */
1869    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1870    public static final int maxContentLength( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> list )
1871    {
1872        final var retValue = maxContentLength( requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).stream() );
1873
1874        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1875        return retValue;
1876    }   //  maxContentLength()
1877
1878    /**
1879     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1880     *  array.
1881     *
1882     *  @param  a   The strings.
1883     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1884     *      in the array are {@code null}, and
1885     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1886     *      if the given array has zero length.
1887     *
1888     *  @since 0.0.5
1889     */
1890    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1891    public static final int maxContentLength( final CharSequence... a )
1892    {
1893        final var retValue = maxContentLength( Arrays.stream( requireNonNullArgument( a, "a" ) ) );
1894
1895        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1896        return retValue;
1897    }   //  maxContentLength()

1899    /**
1900     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1901     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1902     *
1903     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1904     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1905     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1906     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1907     *  @param  mode    The
1908     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1909     *  @param  clip    {@code true} if the input string {@code s} should
1910     *      be cut in case it is longer than {@code length}, {@code false}
1911     *      if it has to be returned unchanged .
1912     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1913     *
1914     *  @since 0.0.5
1915     */
1916    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1917    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final boolean clip )
1918    {
1919        return pad( s, length, c, mode, clip ? CLIPPING_CUT : CLIPPING_NONE );
1920    }   //  pad()
1921
1922    /**
1923     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1924     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1925     *
1926     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1927     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1928     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1929     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1930     *  @param  mode    The
1931     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1932     *  @param  clip    The
1933     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Clipping clipping mode}.
1934     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1935     *
1936     *  @since 0.0.5
1937     */
1938    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1939    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final Clipping clip )
1940    {
1941        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1942        if( ((requireNonNullArgument( clip, "clip" ) == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE) && (length < 4)) || ((clip == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE) && (length < 5)) )
1943        {
1944            throw new ValidationException( format( "Length %d is too short for clipping mode %s", length, clip.toString() ) );
1945        }
1946        requireNonNullArgument( mode, "mode" );
1947
1948        final String retValue;
1949        final var currentLength = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
1950
1951        if( (length > 0) && (length != currentLength) )
1952        {
1953            if( currentLength > length )
1954            {
1955                retValue = clip.clip( s, length );
1956            }
1957            else
1958            {
1959                final var padSize = length - currentLength;
1960                retValue = mode.pad( s, padSize, c );
1961            }
1962        }
1963        else
1964        {
1965            retValue = s.toString();
1966        }
1967
1968        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1969        return retValue;
1970    }   //  pad()
1971
1972    /**
1973     *  Fills up the given string to the given length by adding blanks on both
1974     *  sides; will abbreviate the string if it is longer than the given
1975     *  length. The minimum length is 5.<br>
1976     *  <br>This is a shortcut to a call to
1977     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ) }.
1978     *
1979     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1980     *  @param  length  The desired length; minimum value is 5.
1981     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1982     *
1983     *  @see Padding#PADDING_CENTER
1984     *  @see Clipping#CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
1985     *
1986     *  @since 0.0.5
1987     */
1988    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1989    public static final String padCenter( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ); }
1990

2029    /**
2030     *  Repeats the given char {@code repeat} to form a new String. The table
2031     *  below shows the various  result for some argument combinations.<br>
2032     *  <br><code>
2033     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;0&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2034     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;3&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"aaa"<br>
2035     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;-2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2036     *  </code>
2037     *
2038     *  @param  c   The character to repeat.
2039     *  @param  repeat  The number of times to repeat {@code c}; a negative
2040     *      value will be treated as zero.
2041     *  @return A new String consisting of the given character repeated
2042     *      {@code repeat} times, or the empty String if {@code repeat} was 0
2043     *      or negative.
2044     *
2045     *  @see String#repeat(int)
2046     *
2047     *  @since 0.0.5
2048     */
2049    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2050    public static final String repeat( final char c, final int repeat )
2051    {
2052        final var retValue = (repeat > 0 ? Character.toString( c ).repeat( repeat ) : EMPTY_STRING).intern();
2053
2054        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2055        return retValue;
2056    }   //  repeat()
2057
2058    /**
2059     *  Repeats the given char {@code repeat}, identified by its code point, to
2060     *  form a new String. The
2061     *  table below shows the various  result for some argument
2062     *  combinations.<br>
2063     *  <br><code>
2064     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;0&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2065     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;3&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"aaa"<br>
2066     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;-2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2067     *  </code>
2068     *
2069     *  @param  codePoint   The character to repeat.
2070     *  @param  repeat  The number of times to repeat {@code c}; a negative
2071     *      value will be treated as zero.
2072     *  @return A new String consisting of the given character repeated
2073     *      {@code repeat} times, or the empty String if {@code repeat} was 0
2074     *      or negative, or {@code null} if the code point is invalid.
2075     *
2076     *  @see Character#isValidCodePoint(int)
2077     *  @see String#repeat(int)
2078     *
2079     *  @since 0.0.5
2080     */
2081    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2082    public static final String repeat( final int codePoint, final int repeat )
2083    {
2084        final var retValue = (repeat > 0)
2085            ? isValidCodePoint( codePoint )
2086                ? Character.toString( codePoint ).repeat( repeat ).intern()
2087                : null
2088            : EMPTY_STRING;
2089
2090        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2091        return retValue;
2092    }   //  repeat()
2093
2094    /**
2095     *  Repeats the given String {@code repeat} times to form a new String. The
2096     *  table below shows the various  result for some argument
2097     *  combinations.<br>
2098     *  <br><code>
2099     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;null,&nbsp;2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;null<br>
2100     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"",&nbsp;0&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2101     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"",&nbsp;2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2102     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"a",&nbsp;3&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"aaa"<br>
2103     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"ab",&nbsp;2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"abab"<br>
2104     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"a",&nbsp;-2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2105     *  </code>
2106     *
2107     *  @param  s The String to repeat, may be {@code null}.
2108     *  @param repeat   The number of times to repeat {@code str}; a negative
2109     *      value will be treated as zero.
2110     *  @return A new String consisting of the original String repeated,
2111     *      {@code repeat} times, the empty String if {@code repeat} was 0
2112     *      or negative, or {@code null} if the input String was
2113     *      {@code null}, too.
2114     *
2115     *  @see String#repeat(int)
2116     *
2117     *  @since 0.0.5
2118     */
2119    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2120    public static final String repeat( final CharSequence s, final int repeat )
2121    {
2122        final var retValue =
2123            nonNull( s )
2124                ? (repeat > 0) && !s.isEmpty()
2125                    ? s.toString().repeat( repeat )
2126                    : EMPTY_STRING
2127                : null;
2128
2129        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2130        return retValue;
2131    }   //  repeat()
